intro: Conophyllum kubusanum, commonly known as the Kubusanum conophyllum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in well-drained soils.
